posts.post_content:
Let's propose neat abilities for the vanilla creatures that get printed in each new core set. Who knows, a bored Wizards developer may happen upon one...  
  
---  
  
Any number of creatures may ride Siege Mastodon.  
  
Creatures riding Siege Mastodon gain trample and attack each turn if able.  
  
Soldier's Mount ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) *(![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol): Attach this creature to target Soldier creature you control. While attached, this creature cannot attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated. Mount only as a sorcery.)*
posts.html:
Let's propose neat abilities for the vanilla creatures that get printed in each new core set. Who knows, a bored Wizards developer may happen upon one...

---

Any number of creatures may ride Siege Mastodon.

Creatures riding Siege Mastodon gain trample and attack each turn if able.

Soldier's Mount (: Attach this creature to target Soldier creature you control. While attached, this creature cannot attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated. Mount only as a sorcery.)

posts.post_content:
I think having a large vanilla and a small vanilla in each core set, for each color, showing its power/toughness relation to mana cost because of its color would be nice.  
  
Perhaps the smaller or larger having the 'french vanilla' abilities, blue flying, white vigilance, green trample, red haste, and black... something, death touch maybe, would be another way to include a cycle that are somewhat interesting, and informative, teaching players in the least boring way possible.  
  
Imagine this card with vigilance, maybe one less power, wouldn't it be cooler? In limited, wouldn't you be very glad to see it?
posts.html:
I think having a large vanilla and a small vanilla in each core set, for each color, showing its power/toughness relation to mana cost because of its color would be nice.

Perhaps the smaller or larger having the 'french vanilla' abilities, blue flying, white vigilance, green trample, red haste, and black... something, death touch maybe, would be another way to include a cycle that are somewhat interesting, and informative, teaching players in the least boring way possible.

Imagine this card with vigilance, maybe one less power, wouldn't it be cooler? In limited, wouldn't you be very glad to see it?
